actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual with 20 years of covered work may qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze without regard to when the work was performed.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends Title II (Old Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual with twenty years of work covered by such title may qualify for disability insurance benefits without regard to when the work was performed.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual with 20 years of covered work may qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze without regard to when the work was performed.
